acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 48-hour EC50 = 3.1 mg/L for crustaceans (Daphnia magna) (Test for the Ecological Effect of Chemical Substances (Ministry of the Environment), 2004), the substance was classified into Category 2.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on its rat LD50 of > 2000 mg/kg (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since its rat LC50 = 70.81 mg/L (11825 ppmV) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 4. As its saturated vapour concentration is 305.3 mg/L, we figured that the study was conducted in a vapour state with almost no included mists.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since its rat LD50 = 15000 mg/kg (Toxicity Testing Reports of Environmental Chemicals (Chemicals Investigation Promoting Council), accessed in September 2008), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its classification for acute toxicity is Category 2, and it is not rapidly degradable (non-biodegradable, DO: 0% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1986)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since its flash point is 12degC (HSDB (2003)) and its initial boiling point is 103.46degC (Howard (1997)), the substance was classified into Category 2.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible due to lack of in vivo test results as well as positive results in in vitro mutagenicity tests using several indices. As additional notes, most Ames tests conducted gave negative results (Toxicity Testing Reports of Environmental Chemicals (Chemicals Investigation Promoting Council), accessed in September 2008; IUCLID (2000)) and chromosomal aberration tests using CHL/IU cells yielded negative results (Toxicity Testing Reports of Environmental Chemicals (Chemicals Investigation Promoting Council), accessed in September 2008).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: It is a compound containing fluorine (but not oxygen or chlorine), which is bonded only to carbon.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its autoignition point is 620degC (NFPA (13th, 2006)), which is above 70degC.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In reproductive toxicity tests using rats, no effects of the substance on sexual functions and fertility were noted in parental animals; and in offspring, no external abnormalities were detected while suppressed body weight gain was noted (Toxicity Testing Reports of Environmental Chemicals (Chemicals Investigation Promoting Council), accessed in September 2008). These reports, however, provide insufficient information regarding developmental toxicity to offspring. Thus, classification is not possible due to insufficient data available.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Rabbit tests (OECD TG 405) found that the substance is not irritating (IUCLID (2000)). Based on this document, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In 2-week oral administration tests using rats, the following effects were observed at 100 mg/kg (90-day conversion: 15.5 mg/kg) or higher doses, which fall under Category 2 guidance values: centrilobular hepatocyte hypertrophy in both sexes; appearance of hyaline droplets in the proximal renal tubular epithelium in male rats; and necrosis, basophilic change, and dilatation of the proximal renal tubule. As we considered the appearance of hyaline droplets, and necrosis and dilatation of the proximal renal tubule as male specific responses, and there are no other studies available, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
